summary: Internal FBI email chain from November 12, 2020, discussing media presence at the FBI Miami office related to an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) victim briefing in the Epstein case. The emails coordinate communication strategy to correct erroneous reporting that the FBI is giving the brief, noting that the DOJ is responsible for the report and will issue a statement.

persons.name: Special Agent Young
persons.context: Appears as the sender/signer of the final email in the chain, associated with the FBI New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit.

events.title: Epstein OPR Victim Briefing at FBI Miami
events.description: An OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) victim briefing related to the Epstein case is scheduled to occur at the FBI Miami office, attracting press attention on site.

keyFacts: On November 12, 2020, press was present at the FBI Miami office due to an Epstein-related OPR victim briefing.
There was erroneous media reporting that the FBI was giving the brief; internal emails clarify the DOJ is responsible for the report and statement.
The FBI was referring media calls to the DOJ regarding the briefing.
The correspondence involves FBI personnel from New York and Miami coordinating on public communication strategy.
